content.question: The twice-differentiable functions f and g are defined for all real numbers x. Values of f, f', g, and g' for various values of x are given in the table above. (a) Find the x-coordinate of each relative minimum of f on the interval [-2, 3]. Justify your answers.

frqParts.text: The twice-differentiable functions f and g are defined for all real numbers x. Values of f, f', g, and g' for various values of x are given in the table above. (a) Find the x-coordinate of each relative minimum of f on the interval [-2, 3]. Justify your answers.
(b) Explain why there must be a value c, for -1 < c < 1, such that f''(c) = 0.
(c) The function h is defined by h(x) = ln(f(x)). Find h'(3). Show the computations that lead to your answer.

(d) Evaluate <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mrow> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mrow> <mn>3</mn> </msubsup> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>g</mi> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <msup> <mi>g</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mtext> </mtext> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@45EC@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

unit.text: 3: Differentiation: Composite, Implicit, and Inverse Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
